notifications.title: Notifications

overview.inboxDesc: All your notifications with filter functions
overview.settingsDesc: Manage general settings and email addresses

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: AI Discovery allows you to find data sources through a simple prompt:
overview.howItWorksDesc: Enter a natural search term (e.g., 'All German Bundesliga football clubs'), and the AI will automatically search the internet for matching sources.
overview.autoTagsDesc: The AI automatically generates appropriate tags based on the prompt and found data.
overview.previewDesc: You see all found sources in a preview and can select which ones to import.

workflow.title: Workflow
workflow.step1Desc: Describe what kind of data sources you want to find.
workflow.step2Desc: Quick (3 queries), Standard (5 queries) or Deep (8 queries)
workflow.step3Desc: The AI generates search strategies and searches the web.
workflow.step4Desc: See the found sources with automatically generated tags.
workflow.step5Desc: Select the desired sources and optionally target categories.

searchDepth.title: Search Depth
searchDepth.quickDesc: 3 search queries, fast results, less comprehensive
searchDepth.deepDesc: 8 search queries, most thorough search, longer duration

tagGeneration.title: Automatic Tag Generation
tagGeneration.description: The AI generates tags based on:

smartQueryIntegration.title: Smart Query Integration
smartQueryIntegration.description: AI Discovery can also be used via Smart Query:
smartQueryIntegration.note: The difference to CREATE_CATEGORY_SETUP: DISCOVER_SOURCES searches the internet for NEW sources, while CREATE_CATEGORY_SETUP uses existing DataSources.

kiFirstApproach.title: AI-First Approach (V2)
kiFirstApproach.description: The new AI-First approach follows this flow:
kiFirstApproach.step1Desc: Saved API templates are checked via keyword matching
kiFirstApproach.step2Desc: The AI generates matching API endpoints based on its knowledge
kiFirstApproach.step3Desc: Suggested APIs are automatically tested (HTTP request, JSON parsing)
kiFirstApproach.step4Desc: Valid APIs directly deliver structured data with automatic field mapping
kiFirstApproach.step5Desc: Web search is only started if no APIs work

apiTemplates.title: API Templates
apiTemplates.description: Successful API discoveries can be saved as templates:
apiTemplates.saveTemplateDesc: After successful validation, you can click 'Save as Template'
apiTemplates.keywordsDesc: Define keywords that will automatically activate this template in future searches
apiTemplates.reuseDesc: Saved templates are checked before AI generation - faster and more reliable
apiTemplates.managementDesc: Admins can manage templates under Administration → API Templates

resultTypes.title: Result Types
resultTypes.apiSourcesDesc: Data directly from validated APIs (e.g., OpenLigaDB) - structured and reliable
resultTypes.webSourcesDesc: Found websites as fallback when no APIs work
resultTypes.apiSuggestionsDesc: All AI-generated suggestions with validation status

tips.title: Tips
tips.specific: Be specific - 'Municipalities in NRW' yields better results than 'Municipalities'
tips.checkTags: Review the generated tags before import and adjust if needed
tips.categories: Select appropriate categories to directly assign the imported sources
tips.saveTemplates: Save successful API discoveries as templates for faster future searches
tips.useApis: API sources are more reliable than web sources - prioritize them when importing

dataSourceTags.title: DataSource Tags
dataSourceTags.description: Tags enable flexible categorization of data sources for filtering and category assignment.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Tags are used to categorize and filter data sources:

addTags.title: Adding Tags
addTags.description: There are several ways to add tags to data sources:
addTags.manualDesc: Tags can be entered when creating or editing a data source in the 'Tags' field
addTags.bulkImportDesc: CSV format with tags column: Name;URL;SourceType;Tags
addTags.apiImportDesc: Default tags are automatically applied (e.g. nrw, kommunal)

categoryAssignment.title: Tag-based Category Assignment
categoryAssignment.description: In the category dialog, you can assign data sources via tags:
categoryAssignment.step1: Open the category dialog and switch to the 'Data Sources' tab
categoryAssignment.step4: Review the found data sources in the preview
categoryAssignment.step5: Click 'Assign All' to add the data sources to the category

matchModes.title: Match Modes
matchModes.allDesc: Source must have all selected tags
matchModes.anyDesc: Source must have at least one of the selected tags

apiImport.title: API Import with Tags
apiImport.description: API import automatically creates tags based on the data source:
apiImport.wikidataDesc: Imports municipalities by state with automatic tags (e.g. 'nrw', 'kommunal')

filtering.title: Filtering by Tags
filtering.description: In the data sources overview, you can filter by tags:
filtering.sidebar: The sidebar shows all available tags with counts
filtering.click: Click on a tag to filter
